message.content:
cs.CR, cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SY, cs.AI. 

The paper proposes an information-theoretic framework for a Location Verification System (LVS) in wireless networks. The paper discusses the optimization of the threshold used in the detection of a spoofed location in terms of mutual information, which falls under the category of information theory (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the practical scenario of making a binary decision based on signal strength values obtained by base stations, which falls under the category of networking and internet architecture (cs.NI). The paper's focus on location verification and defence against location spoofing attacks suggests that it could also fall under the categories of security and cryptography (cs.CR) and systems and control (cs.SY). Finally, the paper's use of simulations to verify the analytical framework suggests that it could also fall under the category of artificial intelligence (cs.AI).
